raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Cell injury due to drug metabolites", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This patient has a photosensitive rash after sun exposure while taking demeclocycline, a tetracycline antibiotic known to cause phototoxic reactions. Phototoxicity occurs when drug metabolites in the skin absorb UV light, leading to direct cellular injury and inflammation. The distribution of the rash on sun-exposed areas and the timing after sunlight exposure are classic for this reaction. Other options do not fit: mast cell degranulation is seen in urticaria/anaphylaxis; drug-induced autoantibodies cause conditions like drug-induced lupus; porphobilinogen accumulation is seen in porphyrias, which present differently.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
